result.execSummary:
The defendant Christian Gabriel McGill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False Imprisonment, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Strangulation and Suffocation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
BOTH COUNTS: Provide a DNA sample; pay surcharge. Pay all MANDATORY costs, surcharges and assessments, including the DNA surcharges to be paid from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  All non mandatory costs, fees are waived due to inability to pay.
- Restitution set at zero.

Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession/ body armor/explosives. Defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Defendant must Register as a Sex Offender.

superMiscConds.notes: - Maintain full-time work or school or combination of both.

- No further violations of the law rising to the level of probable cause.
- NO CONTACT with KNH or her family.

- Cooperate with agent.
- Successfully complete Batterers Intervention Counseling.
- Obtain Sex Offender Treatment.
- Obtain any counseling deemed necessary by agent.

- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
- Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with count 3; credit for 175 days time served

records.addlTxt: Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness Kaliyah H. processed and forwarded on 9/27/22 to the AP/Treasurer's Office on Invoice #AT000110 WF in court 1x on 9/19/22.

Defendant Christian Gabriel McGill in court, in custody.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Christian Gabriel McGill.  Prosecuting attorney Alicia H Kort in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
AS TO COUNTS 3 & 4:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.   
Pursuant to negotiations, Counts 1 & 2 are Dismissed, but Read In for sentencing purposes.  

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 

COUNT 3:  The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 6 years  credit for 175 DAYS time served. The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 3 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.
COUNT 4:  The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 6 years , concurrent with Count 3,  credit for 175 DAYS time served. The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 3 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION
- No further violations of the law rising to the level of probable cause.
- Provide a DNA sample. 
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
- Random urine screens
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain full-time work or school or combination of both. 
- Cooperate with agent
- Successfully complete Batterers Intervention counseling
- Obtain sex offender treatment.
- Obtain any counseling deemed necessary by agent.
- NO CONTACT with KNH or her family.
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, surcharges and assessments, including the DNA surcharges to be paid from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
- All non mandatory costs, fees are waived due to inability to pay.
- AS TO COUNTS 3 & 4:  Provide a DNA Sample and pay surcharge.
*Court sets restitution at zero.
- AS TO COUNT 3:  Defendant must register as a sex offender.
*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession/ body armor/explosives. Defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Discussion regarding expungement of Court 3 after sentence is completed.  The Court will not expunge Count 3.  mn

Final pretrial proceeded.  The Motions in limine will be heard on the date of trial.  The State's offer was placed on the record and rejected by defendant.  Pro se motion for bail was not heard as defendant has an attorney.  Case is adjourned for jury status hearing in Br 45.  mn  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christian Gabriel McGill in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Christian Gabriel McGill in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
